page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: (Farming in the area has generally changed very little.) The higher, colder, exposed environment conditions and thin stoney soils over limestone around Rhosesmor still restrict farms to rough pasture for some cattle but mainly for Welsh breeds of sheep reared for meat. The more sheltered farms on the deeper soils around Rhydymwyn continue to still support quite large Fresian dairy herds and sheep on the lusher pastures.Dairy and beef cattle herds are also kept on farms North of Soughton. Farming West of Soughton, though, has shown great changes on the Gwysaney Hall Estate,from traditional sheep farming,based on pasture grown on the dry glacial sands, to woodland.
